Description: Sherd, probably with complete profile, of flaring ring-shaped pottery kiln-support. Micaceous red-brown clay with grey core. Incised inscription.
Curator's comments: The character of the piece is seen better when considered together with comparable items in the British Museum and elsewhere; see Johnston, www.britishmuseum.org/pdf/johnston_ceramic_incriptions 17-18.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 646)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (TG.3)
